meanings.definition: To bill in advance for goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The company will prebill customers for their upcoming subscription.
meanings.sent2: It is common for phone companies to prebill for the next month's service.
meanings.sent3: The magician prebilled the audience for the amazing tricks they were about to see.
meanings.sent4: The teacher prebilled the students for the knowledge they were about to receive.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant prebilled us for the delicious meal we were going to enjoy.

meanings.definition: The act of billing in advance.
meanings.sent1: Prebilling helps companies manage their cash flow more effectively.
meanings.sent2: The prebilling process ensures that customers pay for services before receiving them.
meanings.sent3: The prebilling system at the gym confused some members who were used to paying after their workout.
meanings.sent4: The prebilling department sent out reminders to customers to pay in advance for their services.
meanings.sent5: The prebilling statement arrived in the mail, detailing the upcoming charges for the month.
